content.question:
Oskar Garvens, German artist, Remove this Burden and the World is Cured, 1931
Private Collection Archives Charmet/Bridgeman Images

The title of the piece is reproduced at the bottom of the poster in German, French, Spanish, and Italian

The perspective of the artist regarding the Treaty of Versailles is best explained by which of the following developments at the time the poster was created?

choices.label: German colonies in Africa and Asia had been claimed by the Allies under the League of Nations mandate system.
Germany had been barred from participation in the League of Nations.
The terms of the Versailles treaty had created small democratic states out of German and Habsburg territories in eastern Europe.
The onset of the Great Depression undermined the already unstable economy of the Weimar Republic, which was required to pay reparations to the Allies.

content.answer: The onset of the Great Depression undermined the already unstable economy of the Weimar Republic, which was required to pay reparations to the Allies.
